text:
I only see one keyframe. If there are more, please send them so I can describe each step. For this frame:

Frame 1
- State: Robot is at a neutral, observation pose with gripper open. Workspace contains a red cube (front-left), a blue cube (mid-left), and a yellow tennis ball (mid-right). A plastic drawer unit is an obstacle on the right. No object is grasped; all items are stationary.
- Action: Perception/scene setup. The system has positioned to view the workspace; no manipulation yet.

Strategy check
- The strategy appears to be followed so far (initial perception and setup). No failure mode evident yet.

High-level next steps
- Confirm target object and goal (e.g., which item to pick and where to place).
- Plan a collision-free approach that keeps clearance from the drawer unit on the right.
- If targeting the ball: approach from above, align gripper jaws centered on the ball, set appropriate jaw width, slow final approach, close, lift.
- If targeting a cube: approach top-down, align jaws with opposing faces, close, lift.
- After grasp, transport along a safe path, place at the goal, and verify placement.
